13:20.race_name: Howden Insurance Brokers Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Made low-key handicap debut but may do better dropping in trip with new headgear.
runners.name: Alan Bresil
runners.spotlight: Showed ability in sole point and two novice hurdles but handicap debut at Lingfield last month was underwhelming, even though he may not have stayed 2m7f; more required in a maiden but the drop in trip and first-time cheekpieces may help.

runners.comment: Well-related 5yo but beaten 77l on hurdle debut and looks one for the longer term.
runners.name: Blazing Saint
runners.spotlight: 78,000gns 3yo; out of bumper and smart 2m-2m6f hurdle/chase winner Blazing Tempo, family of top-class jumper Danoli; beaten 77l on last month's hurdle debut at Hereford (150-1) and looks one for the longer term.

runners.comment: Improved switched to a handicap latest and a leading contender back in maiden company.
runners.name: Catch On Me
runners.spotlight: French Flat winner; 0-5 over hurdles but showed marked improvement when finishing a 2.75l third at Uttoxeter (2m4f, good to soft) last month; entitled to come on again; leading contender returned to a maiden.

runners.comment: Modest Flat maiden who showed little on November's hurdle debut.
runners.name: Hialeah
runners.spotlight: Modest Flat maiden who showed little on November's hurdle debut.

runners.comment: Ex-French; disappointing on British debut but in excellent hands and may now do better.
runners.name: Lirone Du Seuil
runners.spotlight: Folded tamely at Wetherby (2m, soft; 14-1) on British debut, failing to back up the promise of his French hurdles effort; however, he's in excellent hands and may do better this time.

runners.comment: Made a promising start for the stable when third on hurdle debut; leading player
runners.name: Quay Item
runners.owner: Middleham Park Racing & M & L Sainsbury
runners.spotlight: £45,000 buy after reaching the frame in two Irish points in 2024 and went off favourite for November's hurdle/stable debut when finishing a promising 7.75l third of six at Doncaster (2m5f, good to soft; second has won twice since); leading player back slightly in trip; improvement likely.

runners.comment: Irish point winner and one to watch in the market on hurdle debut.
runners.name: Lola De Magny
runners.spotlight: £30,000 purchase in December after winning her fourth start in Irish points; dam French 2m1f hurdle winner, half-sister to winners Flogasorte (useful French 1m7f-2m1f hurdle/chase) and Flogarose (1m7f-2m1f hurdle/chase); interesting debutante and one to watch in the market.

runners.comment: Well held in two bumpers and needs to improve for the step up in trip on hurdle debut.
runners.name: Willshebe Court
runners.spotlight: Beaten 22l and 32l in two bumpers (tongue tied latest) and needs to improve significantly for this switch to hurdles now up in trip.

13:50.race_name: Legendary Jimmy James 90th Birthday Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.breeder: Al ShiraAa Farms S A R L
runners.comment: High-class Flat performer who has taken well to hurdles;  key player back in a novice.
runners.name: Ambiente Friendly
runners.spotlight: High-class Flat performer at his best who has taken well to hurdles, winning at Huntingdon in December before pulling too hard and disappointing on handicap debut back there two weeks later; key player with Alex Chadwick offsetting 3lb of his penalty now back in novice company.

runners.comment: Pulled up when hanging badly latest but looked promising prior to that; respected.
runners.name: Looping dArc
runners.owner: Mrs J Fowler & Mrs T Brown
runners.spotlight: Confirmed bumper debut promise when winning on hurdle debut at Southwell (2m, good to soft) last month, but hung badly and pulled up when unsteerable at Hereford two weeks ago; remains open to progress and has strong claims under his penalty if proving more manageable going left-handed.

runners.comment: Pulled up on last month's hurdle debut and others have more obvious claims.
runners.name: Back On Track
runners.spotlight: Made the frame in a couple of points last season, but in the rear throughout before pulled up on last month's hurdle debut at Warwick (150-1); others have more obvious claims.

runners.comment: Has reached the frame on both runs over hurdles and worth considering with more to come.
runners.name: Eddie My Eagle
runners.spotlight: Caught the attention of the stewards when finishing fourth on hurdle debut at Huntingdon in November before chasing home a Dan Skelton-trained odds-on shot at Sedgefield (2m1f, soft) the following month; open to further progress and worth considering.

runners.comment: Irish point third is strong form but he's disappointed so so far in bumper/over hurdles.
runners.name: Golden Prince
runners.spotlight: His third in an Irish point last February was particularly strong form, with plenty of winners emerging from the race; however, he's been disappointing in a bumper and over hurdles on varying ground and looks one for further down the road.

runners.comment: Well beaten on both previous runs over hurdles and looks one for the longer term.
runners.name: Land Of Punt
runners.spotlight: Looked set to justify 2-5 favouritism before last-fence fall on point debut last March, but he's been beaten 53l and 24l on both runs over hurdles (2m) in November; looks one for the longer term.

runners.breeder: G Hedley & Mike Channon Bloodstock Ltd
runners.comment: Marked improvement to finish second over C&D latest and could figure if repeating the run.
runners.name: Reteti
runners.spotlight: Some promise in bumpers; five-race Flat maiden who left behind a couple of modest runs over hurdles when a close second over C&D (good to soft) last month; could figure if reproducing that effort.

runners.comment: Fair Flat maiden who is of interest making hurdle debut for a respected stable.
runners.name: Canopus
runners.spotlight: 0-4 on the Flat but runner-up twice over 1m for Ed Walker; not seen since disappointing at Nottingham in October and subsequently sold for 16,000gns later that month; interesting hurdle debutant for a respected stable, with the market probably the best guide.

runners.comment: Well held on last month's hurdle debut, but there were some positives and he can improve.
runners.name: Northwest Passage
runners.spotlight: Displayed considerable improvement on the Flat once gelded and, although eventually finishing well held on last month's hurdle debut at Newbury (2m, good to soft; 4-1) following a break, there were positives to take and an improved effort would be no surprise; hooded latest but not today.

runners.comment: Made a winning start for this yard in September and won again at Fontwell last month.
runners.name: Superstylin
runners.spotlight: Made a winning start for this yard at Worcester (2m, good) in September and after three placed efforts he returned to winning ways in a weak three-runner contest at Fontwell (2m2f, good to soft) last month; hit by a 5lb rise but should be thereabouts.

runners.breeder: E A R L De Faydeau
runners.comment: Tailed off when last of six on his handicap debut over hurdles; chase debut
runners.name: Known Warrior
runners.spotlight: Yet to be placed from five runs under rules; tailed off when last of six on handicap hurdle debut at Lingfield (2m3f, soft) last month; has had wind surgery since (his second); has a lot to prove on chase debut.

runners.comment: Took fairly well to fences when fourth twice in November (2m3f/2m); soft-ground query.
runners.name: Sanitiser
runners.spotlight: Versatile 7yo who seemed to take fairly well to fences when fourth twice in November (2m3f/2m); needs the refitted blinkers to help him find something extra here, though, and he'd appeal more on good ground; withdrawn due to unsuitable ground (soft) last time.

runners.comment: Entitled to need the run when third on chase/stable debut at Huntingdon; may improve
runners.name: Applicationofcash
runners.spotlight: Entitled to need the run when third of four finishers on chase/stable debut at Huntingdon (2m4f, good to soft) last month following an absence; may well do better this time now back in distance.

runners.comment: Was running a big race when falling three out on chasing debut at Exeter last month.
runners.name: Sea Thrift
runners.spotlight: Off the mark when winning a selling hurdle at Stratford (2m2f, good to soft) in October; she was in the process of running a big race when falling three out on chasing debut at Exeter (2m3f, heavy) last month; should run well as long as her fall hasn't left a mark.

runners.comment: Back to form at Wincanton, then a creditable 6th in the Lanzorote at Kempton; player.
runners.name: Ike Sport
runners.spotlight: Returned to form when runner-up at Wincanton (3m, good to soft) on Boxing Day and backed that up wth a solid sixth in the Lanzorote at Kempton (2m5f, good) 16 days ago off this mark; his losing run continues to mount up but recent efforts suggest he could break that sequence in this easier race.

runners.comment: Running well since switched to handicaps this season and likely to be in the mix again.
runners.name: Good To Be Alive
runners.spotlight: Won 2m heavy-ground maiden on debut for Gordon Elliott over a year ago and has finished runner-up in both runs for this stable since switching to handicaps this season, most recently at Hereford (2m3.5f, soft) last month; likely to be in the thick of it again.

runners.comment: Dual hurdle winner who's holding his form well and another bold bid can be expected.
runners.name: Lucky Manifest
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner at Kelso, most recently in October (2m6.5f, good) on yard debut; followed that with a 1l defeat at Cheltenham (soft) in November before finishing a perfectly acceptable eighth of ten in a Class 2 there last month (3m); now back in trip but should give another good account.

runners.comment: Laboured return over fences last month but reverts to hurdles on a fair mark
runners.name: The Famous Five
runners.spotlight: Let down by his jumping over fences at times but still a capable performer in that sphere, although his reappearance last month was laboured; needs to be forgiven that effort but reverts to hurdles on a fair mark and is 2-7 in this discipline.

runners.comment: Back on her last winning mark but has yet to fire this season and pulled up last week.
runners.name: Pretending
runners.spotlight: Rather hit and miss since her last win (2m4f, good to soft) in October 2024 and she was pulled up at Fakenham eight days ago; back on her last winning mark but has a bit to prove at present.

runners.breeder: E A R L Haras De Montaigu
runners.comment: Has endured a disappointing season so far, but back on a good mark and not ruled out.
runners.name: Patriotik
runners.spotlight: Has had a disappointing season so far, beaten 26l+ on first four starts before a more encouraging front-running effort in first-time cheekpieces (retained) at Ascot (2m3.5f, soft) nine days ago; 6lb lower than latest win last March and eased in class so hard to dismiss completely.

runners.comment: In good form at the end of last year but has to be forgiven a lesser effort last time.
runners.name: Hes A Latchico
runners.spotlight: Took hurdles score to four when winning at Leicester (1m7.5f, soft) in November and produced a solid effort in his follow-up bid off this mark at Ascot the following month; however, he has to be forgiven a below-par effort at Sandown since.

runners.comment: Solid staying form on soft before finding ground quicker than ideal latest; down in grade
runners.name: Getaway Theatre
runners.spotlight: Solid contender on the form of a Chepstow win (2m7f) last February and when narrowly failing to give weight to a subsequent winner at Warwick (3m1f, also on soft) in November; lacked the pace to play a part on good to soft there since but today's surface and lower grade will help.

runners.comment: Has won on yielding but both October wins (2m7f/3m) on good; fell over fences latest
runners.name: Tankardstown Diva
runners.spotlight: Won on yielding ground in Ireland but her two hurdle wins (2m7f and 3m) in October were both on good ground and good to soft is probably as slow as she wants it; fell on her return to fences before Christmas and needs to justify a career-high mark, 7lb higher than her latest win.

runners.comment: Back to form when 3m winner latest (bled from the nose); good claims if all is well
runners.name: Either Or
runners.spotlight: Has won on soft; some low points along the way but she was quite a convincing winner back hurdling at Doncaster (3m, good to soft; first-time tongue-tie) last month, despite the narrow winning margin and bleeding from the nose; the latter issue is a worry and she's back up 5lb but will be a major contender if all is well.

runners.comment: Pulled up over fences latest; stays 3m2f on soft over hurdles; chance off current mark
runners.name: Keppel Queen
runners.spotlight: Showed zero enthusiasm for fences in two attempts, pulling up at Uttoxeter last month, but she might well recover quickly now back hurdling, as in a similar situation in the past; stays 3m2f on soft and has a good run in her off current mark; cheekpieces refitted.

runners.comment: Best form on good to soft or quicker; turnaround needed with Either Or on December form
runners.name: Pipers Cross
runners.spotlight: Has won on soft but best form on good to soft or quicker; yard continues in fine form but Either Or had her measure at Doncaster (3m, good to soft) last month and she has no strong turnaround claims.

15:50.race_name: Tysers Insurance Brokers Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Won first 2 starts in cheekpieces (3m) but well beaten in only completion since break
runners.name: Minella Blueway
runners.spotlight: Won two in a row when cheekpieces first fitted (3m; soft and good to soft) last spring; hard to judge current wellbeing as he's been running in better races since back from a break but he was soundly beaten in his only completion and fell early at Ascot only nine days ago.

runners.comment: Five wins for new yard in the autumn, including over C&D; below best in 3 of last 4 runs
runners.name: Shantou Lucky
runners.spotlight: Had a charmed spell for new yard earlier, five wins including one over C&D (good; also acts on soft); has run up to form only once in his last four starts though, following a revival at Fakenham last month with a tailed-off run at Windsor, and is still 6lb higher than the latest win.

runners.breeder: A Domenjoud & Haras De Saint Voir
runners.comment: Mudlover; good claims on 3m form in April and December; recent rain a plus
runners.name: Georges Saint
runners.spotlight: Mudlover who was out of sorts in just three runs last winter but ran well for a long way in a better race than this at Bangor (3m, soft) in April and kept on gamely when third at Warwick (3m, good to soft) last month; this more testing ground will suit better; solid claims.

runners.comment: 2m4f hurdle winner; has hurdle form at 3m1f; never sighted in 2 chase runs; sights lowered
runners.name: Lumi Plugin
runners.owner: J Hinds A Head & G L Moore
runners.spotlight: Gained 2m4f hurdle win on good ground but he ran well over 3m1f here on soft last February; never sighted in two chases this winter but he still has potential and his sights are lowered here; yard has won two of the last seven runnings.

runners.comment: Has run moderately in two runs for current yard; has it all to prove.
runners.name: Kill The Groove
runners.owner: D Hill N Emanuel & B Chantler
runners.spotlight: Seven-race maiden who left Ben Pauling after flopping over 2m5f in June; changed hands for £9,000 in August but has run moderately in two runs for current yard; has it all to prove.

runners.comment: Well held on handicap debut at Fontwell after absence; needs to have come on for that run.
runners.name: Our Papa Smurf
runners.spotlight: Off the mark over hurdles in juvenile maiden at Warwick (2m, good to soft; 50-1) in December 2024; well held on handicap debut at Fontwell (2m1f, heavy) last month; needs to have come on for that; cheekpieces return.

runners.comment: Won C&D novice last January; well held and pulled up in two handicaps in the autumn.
runners.name: Dotties Star
runners.spotlight: Off the mark when landing a novice over C&D (soft) last January; well held and pulled up in two handicaps last autumn but has dropped another 3lb and cannot dismiss.

runners.comment: Two modest efforts over hurdles but makes handicap debut for in-form yard.
runners.name: Frank Stamper
runners.spotlight: Consistent on AW for previous stable; weakened into modest third at Catterick on hurdle debut, having done too much up front; never involved when fourth of six finishers at Kempton (2m, good; first-time hood, retained) 16 days ago; makes handicap debut for in-form yard; one to keep an eye on.

runners.comment: Huge odds and has shown nothing so far over hurdles; handicap debut.
runners.name: Ephyra
runners.spotlight: Placed at a lowly level on the Flat for David Menuisier; huge odds and has shown nothing so far over hurdles but might fare better now handicapping.

runners.comment: Distant third over C&D in November; below that form here last month; handicap debut.
runners.name: Suzy Wood
runners.spotlight: 0-5 under rules; distant third over C&D (good) in November but below that form on this track last month; may do better now that she steps into handicaps.

runners.comment: Disappointing over hurdles and has not beaten a rival on his last two handicap starts.
runners.name: Master Dunraven
runners.spotlight: Won twice for Johnny Murtagh over 1m2f on the Flat in 2024; modest over hurdles so far and has not beaten a rival on his last two starts in handicaps; hood worn last time is discarded.

14:00.race_name: Hereford Easter Monday Family Fun Raceday Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Won on hurdles debut at Huntingdon last month before finishing second at Doncaster.
runners.name: Draco Malfoy
runners.owner: Sir F Brooke & Sir R Pilkington
runners.spotlight: Irish point winner; lacked the gears to win a bumper last term but made a perfect start to this discipline when successful at Huntingdon (2m4f, soft) last month; no disgrace in finishing second of six finishers to a progressive type at Doncaster (2m3f, good) subsequently and should run well.

runners.comment: Second on his first two starts over hurdles but pulled up subsequently at Ascot.
runners.name: Big Ticket
runners.spotlight: Irish point winner; made a promising start over hurdles when runner-up at Aintree and Ascot in the autumn; subsequently suffered an overreach when pulled up at Ascot (2m5f, soft) last month; should enjoy this easier assignment away from the big tracks and should go close if all is well.

runners.comment: Beaten 27l when fifth on his debut at Warwick; steps up in trip and improvement required.
runners.name: Ercall Fox
runners.spotlight: Beaten 27l when fifth of 12 finishers on his debut at Warwick (2m, good to soft; 200-1); steps up in trip and big improvement required.

runners.comment: Made a promising start to his hurdles career when fourth at Cheltenham this month.
runners.name: Handin Manypockets
runners.spotlight: Third in an Irish point in November, he made a promising start to his hurdles career when fourth of seven at Cheltenham (2m4f, good) this month; needs to improve but that is not out of the question.

runners.comment: Dual point winner in February/March but well held on both starts over hurdles.
runners.name: Star Of Honour
runners.spotlight: Dual point winner in February/March but well held on both starts over hurdles in November/December; looks one for the future.

14:30.race_name: Hereford Quarries Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Made virtually all at Ludlow and Exeter on last two starts; looks the one to catch.
runners.name: Followcato
runners.spotlight: 0-5 over hurdles last term but has got his act together over fences since the application of cheekpieces and adopting front-running tactics, getting off the mark at Ludlow (2m4f, good to soft) last month and following up at Exeter (2m3f, good to soft) 17 days ago; 6lb rise makes it tougher but looks sure to be the one to catch.

runners.comment: Runner-up on both chase starts and looks ready to open his account.
runners.name: Ski Lodge
runners.owner: Noel Fehily Racing Syndicate - Ski Lodge
runners.spotlight: Bumper/hurdles winner on heavy/soft; showed plenty to work on when making crucial mistakes when runner-up to one that has won again since on his chasing debut at Uttoxeter (3m, heavy) last month; jumped much better when runner-up at Haydock (3m1f, good to soft) subsequently; steps back in trip and looks ready to open his account over fences.

runners.comment: Won mares' handicap hurdle at Kempton last February but disappointing since; chase debut.
runners.name: Epinephrine
runners.spotlight: Won a mares' handicap hurdle at Kempton last February (2m, good to soft); went up 9lb and has been disappointing on both starts since, including when stepped up to 2m5f at Warwick on reappearance (good to soft); has her stamina to prove on her first run over fences.

runners.breeder: S C E A Haras Du Ma & Mr Marc Dumont
runners.comment: Yet to win over fences but a few decent runs, latest when third at Exeter 17 days ago.
runners.name: Risk De Pluie
runners.spotlight: Point winner; won a Fontwell novice hurdle on rules debut in January 2024 (2m3f, soft); yet to win over fences but a few decent runs, latest when third of nine finishers at Exeter (2m1f, good to soft) 17 days ago; has a chase win in him.

runners.comment: Mixes hurdling and chasing but yet to win in this sphere; dropped to a career-low mark.
runners.name: Hurricane Highway
runners.spotlight: Mixes hurdling and chasing but yet to win in this sphere; has dropped to a career-low mark but has his work cut out against more progressive rivals.

15:00.race_name: Green Dragon Hotel Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Five-time chase winner who relishes testing ground; runner-up on both starts this term.
runners.name: Royal Mer
runners.spotlight: Five-time chase winner who relishes testing ground; runner-up on both starts this term and looks sure to go close.

runners.comment: Second on his return to fences last month; tailed off since but today's ground can help.
runners.name: Mon Champion
runners.spotlight: Ex-French 6yo who won over hurdles at Auteuil on heavy in 2024; shaped well on return to fences for this yard when second at Sandown (1m7f, good to soft) last month but disappointing subsequently when tailed off at Newbury (2m, good); this return to forecast soft ground should be in his favour and cannot dismiss.

runners.comment: Tailed off over hurdles here last month and back over fences at Exeter 17 days ago.
runners.name: Wewillgowithplanb
runners.spotlight: Both chase wins came when trained by Richard Bandey; tailed off over hurdles here (2m3f, soft) last month and back over fences at Exeter (2m1f, good to soft) 17 days ago; down to a career-low mark but has it all to prove.

runners.comment: Only fifth at Exeter last time but runner-up on first three starts this term.
runners.name: Passing Kate
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late David M Richards
runners.spotlight: Won three times last season on soft/heavy ground; runner-up on first three starts this term then fifth at Exeter (2m1f, good to soft) 17 days ago when three places behind Royal Mer; today's forecast slow ground could aid her cause.

runners.comment: Fourth on chasing debut at Wetherby and unseated four out at Lingfield last month.
runners.name: Hors Jeu
runners.spotlight: French hurdle winner in spring 2024; untidy round of jumping when fourth of six on chasing debut at Wetherby (1m7f, soft) in November and unseated four out at Lingfield (2m, good to soft) last month; needs to polish up his jumping.

15:30.race_name: Silvershine Turf Services Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Qualifier)

runners.comment: Grade 1 runner-up in 2023; needs watching in market on second run after a mammoth absence
runners.name: LAstroboy
runners.spotlight: Won his first two starts (bumper/hurdle) in 2022 before two runner-up efforts, including in Grade 1 novice at Sandown (2m, soft); well held on handicap debut there last month but that was after a mammoth absence and he's still unexposed; one of two runners for Evan Williams and he needs watching in market.

runners.comment: Unexposed 8yo who returned from long absence with promising third at Carlisle; interesting
runners.name: Out Of Office
runners.spotlight: Point/maiden hurdle winner who returned after 753 days off with a rallying third back over hurdles at Carlisle (2m1f, soft; hood added) in November; that was a promising effort behind an improver and he still has potential as a handicapper; interesting contender.

runners.comment: Ex-French 5yo who has struggled in two runs for new yard this winter; needs major revival
runners.name: Col du Pre
runners.spotlight: Flat (1m4f, soft) and hurdle winner (2m1f, very soft) when trained in France, but he's struggled in two handicaps for new yard this winter; on reduced mark and conditions should be ideal here but he needs a major revival.

runners.comment: Dual hurdle winner who was second behind a big improver at Market Rasen latest; respected
runners.name: Nowmelad
runners.spotlight: Won twice for the Newland/Insole stable in the autumn of 2024; creditable efforts in three of his four runs for current yard including when a close second in Market Rasen handicap (2m2f, good to soft) on Boxing Day; up 3lb but he went down fighting last time and that was behind a major improver; respected.

runners.comment: Returns after 356 days off but he's on workable mark and needs close look for new yard
runners.name: Latin Verse
runners.spotlight: Has patchy profile but he's feasibly treated on best form and was disputing second when he fell at the last at Taunton (2m, soft) in final run last season; returns after almost a year off but conditions are no problem and he needs a close look on first run for Olly Murphy.

runners.comment: Some good runs last summer but not sure this drop back in trip is ideal on his return
runners.name: Ukantango
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner who is generally reliable and was a creditable fourth of 14 at Uttoxeter (2m4f, good) when last seen in July; 1lb lower on his return but not sure this drop back in trip is ideal and all of his runs last year were on good ground; stablemate of Latin Verse.

runners.comment: Five-time chase winner but he faces a stiff task trying to concede weight all round.
runners.name: Camino Rocio
runners.spotlight: Five-time chase winner (2m4f-3m) for Jim and Suzi Best, most recently in March last year at Huntingdon (good; has also won on soft) but form has dipped since; reached the frame in two points in December but faces a much stiffer task on hunter chase debut conceding weight all round.

runners.comment: Pulled up since winning at Larkhill in November and looks up against it on these terms.
runners.name: A Jet Of Our Own
runners.spotlight: In good form in hunter chases last spring, notably when finishing fifth over the big fences at Aintree  (2m5f, good to soft); returned from break with a win at Larkhill (good) in November but he's been pulled up in a Taunton hunter chase since; a likely type to bounce back but faces a tough task at the weights.

runners.comment: Recent return may have been needed but he'll need to improve to trouble a couple of these
runners.name: Important Notice
runners.spotlight: 4-10 in points (2m4f-3m) but yet to win in open company; in good form in that sphere early in 2025  and signed off the campaign with a respectable third on hunter chase debut at Cheltenham (3m2f, good) in May; recent return may have been needed, but he'll need to improve considerably to trouble a couple of these.

runners.breeder: S C E A Haras Des Sablonnets Et Al
runners.comment: Useful hurdler/chaser in his pomp and type to make his presence felt at this lower level.
runners.name: Quel Destin
runners.spotlight: Useful hurdler/chaser in his pomp who is a three-time chase winner, with back-to-back wins coming in December 2023; below that level in limited appearances since, including after a third wind operation; nevertheless, he could still make his presence felt at this lower level.

runners.comment: On a long losing run and out of sorts late last year; drops in class with a bit to prove.
runners.name: Snipe
runners.spotlight: 2-17 over fences but his most recent success was just over two years ago; began this campaign off well enough with three consecutive fourths before his form slumped late late last year, and now switches to hunter chases with a bit to prove.

runners.comment: 2022 NH chase winner who has a long absence to overcome but is still the one to beat.
runners.name: Stattler
runners.spotlight: 2022 National Hunt Chase winner, with several decent efforts in Grade 1s and 2s since, but he's been absent since pulling up in the 2024 Grand National on final start for Willie Mullins; off for 653 days but the one to beat if retaining much of his ability on hunter chase and stable debut.

16:30.race_name: Hereford Ladies Day Saturday 7th March Mares' Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Back to form with a second over C&D and that was behind a major improver; respected
runners.name: Gower Spirit
runners.spotlight: Has patchy profile but she won a handicap at Uttoxeter (2m4f, heavy) in November and got back on track with a second over C&D (soft) two weeks ago; back up 3lb but she chased home a subsequent winner last time and that was in a much deeper race; respected.

runners.comment: Looked set to complete the hat-trick at Fakenham but unseated rider on run-in; big player
runners.name: Princess Keri
runners.spotlight: Improved form back over hurdles in the autumn, winning in good style at Lingfield (2m, good to soft) and Ludlow (2m5f, good); looked set to complete the hat-trick at Fakenham (2m4f, good to soft) last Sunday but rider got unbalanced after the final flight and was unseated; turns out off same mark here and has leading claims if she can avoid any mishaps.

runners.comment: Sole win was in December 2023 and has struggled in last five runs; cheekpieces added
runners.name: Ezmerellda
runners.spotlight: Won Doncaster maiden (2m, good to soft) in December 2023 but she's a drawn a blank since and things have not gone well in two runs for her current yard; mark continues to fall but has plenty to prove back up in trip; cheekpieces added.

runners.comment: Won at Bangor last February but she's not come close to that form since; out of weights
runners.name: Chosen Bae
runners.spotlight: Won a Bangor handicap (2m3f, soft) last February, but she's struggled since and has been beaten 22l and 32l in her two runs this winter; 2lb out of the weights again and she needs a big turnaround.

15:55.race_name: Make The Move To Midnite Handicap (Div I)

runners.comment: Mixed nowadays but won over 5f here latest; well treated on best 6f form despite penalty
runners.name: Master Dandy
runners.spotlight: More troughs than peaks on AW since August but this headgear combination seems to suit and he confirmed some 5f promise at Chelmsford two runs ago when winning over that trip here last week; drawn wider today but effectively just 3lb higher and is well treated on past 6f form.

runners.comment: C&D winner; two good course runs for new yard; hampered at Newcastle latest
runners.name: Hes An Angel
runners.spotlight: C&D winner whose best two races for his current yard have come on this track; hampered when fifth of six at Newcastle recently and should have another good run in him.

runners.comment: Best run for a while when 2nd at Southwell (6f) this month but below best since
runners.name: Court Of Session
runners.spotlight: Acts on both AW surfaces, although all four wins on Polytrack, most recently in late 2023; ran his best race for a while when runner-up at Southwell (6f; winner won again since) but not as good since and this may not provide enough of a stamina test for him.

runners.comment: Has won at 7f/6f here; new trainer but made winning yard debut for two most recent stables
runners.name: Koji
runners.spotlight: Has been off since September but she made a winning debut for her two most recent trainers, over 7f on this track (she's also won over today's C&D) and on turf; has won after a break too so has to be of interest for new yard.

runners.comment: Winning course debut (6f) this month; strong-finishing 3rd at Lingfield since; can go well
runners.name: East Tyrone
runners.owner: Alan And David Fairhurst And P Kirby
runners.spotlight: In good form over 6f, leading near the line in a C&D classified (third has won twice since) before coming home strongly into third at Lingfield; looks interesting back here in only his second course start.

runners.comment: Off the mark at Southwell (6f) on 2nd start for yard; mixed since; return to 6f can suit
runners.name: Up The Monk
runners.spotlight: Broke duck on Southwell Tapeta (6f) in August on second start for the yard; mostly nondescript efforts have followed but he didn't look out of sorts over 7f at Chelmsford recently and the return to 6f should suit.

runners.comment: Big prices and no impact in 3 runs at 7f/6f; most realistic task to date; lots more needed
runners.name: Optimistic
runners.spotlight: Triple-figure prices and has made no impact in three qualifying runs at 7f and 6f; this is his first realistic chance now handicapping but needs a lot more even so; hooded all starts, now visored.

runners.breeder: D & S L Tanker Transport Ltd
runners.comment: Two C&D wins; retains ability for new trainer but hasn't beaten a rival on last two starts
runners.name: Tommytwohoots
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner who retains ability for his new trainer but he's failed to beat a rival on his last two starts, back over C&D ten days ago; has been wearing headgear but not today; limited appeal for now.

runners.comment: C&D winner in 2023; thereabouts in early 2025; out of the frame in 5 AW runs this winter
runners.name: Bernie The Bear
runners.spotlight: Three AW wins in 2023, the latest over C&D; regularly on the premises in early 2025 but he's been big prices and finished out of the frame in five Newcastle runs this winter; likely best watched.

runners.comment: Two wins over C&D but has beaten very few rivals on the AW since the autumn
runners.name: Coast
runners.spotlight: Four AW wins include two over C&D but she's beaten very few rivals on the AW since the autumn and remains on the back burner for now.

16:25.race_name: Make The Move To Midnite Handicap (Div II)

runners.comment: Polytrack winner last May, but she's struggled since including over hurdles; lots to prove
runners.name: Big Gypsy King
runners.spotlight: 7f AW winner for the Coles last May, but she's struggled since including in two hurdle runs for current yard; still has low mileage but she returns after another break and has plenty to prove back in this sphere; first-time cheekpieces.

runners.comment: Resurgent 6yo who made it 2-4 for current yard when scoring at Newcastle; respected up 3lb
runners.name: Okami
runners.spotlight: Resurgent 6yo who made it 2-4 for Paul Midgley when scoring at Newcastle (5f, Tapeta) 17 days ago; up 3lb for that narrow success but he remains well treated on old form and he's won at up to 7f in the past; respected back up in trip.

runners.comment: His last three wins have been over C&D and was runner-up here ten days ago; shortlisted
runners.name: Nordic Glory
runners.spotlight: His last three wins have been over C&D and he was runner-up back at this track ten days ago; that was his third placed effort from his last four runs and he remains feasibly treated off only 2lb higher than for last win; shortlisted.

runners.comment: Ten-time winner but she's not easy to predict and was disappointing here last time
runners.name: Gilt Edge
runners.spotlight: Veteran who scored over C&D in October, but she's not easy to predict and was 6l behind Nordic Glory here ten days ago; needs to bounce back again after that disappointing run and others are more persuasive.

runners.comment: Recorded his 11th win when forging clear at Lingfield; big player again up 6lb
runners.name: Porfin
runners.spotlight: 8yo who recorded his 11th win when beating seven rivals at Lingfield (6f) last Saturday; up 6lb but that was a clearcut success and he's a triple winner at this track; big player again in his bid for a double.

runners.comment: 100-1 win here last spring but was last of seven on his comeback over C&D ten days ago
runners.name: Devilwala
runners.spotlight: Smart in his younger days but, given his form last winter, his 100-1 success in a 0-50 classified event over C&D in March was still a big shock; may have needed his comeback run over 5f here ten days ago but he finished last of seven and needs to leave that form a long way behind.

runners.comment: In-form 8yo and has possibilities if he gets a good pace and some luck
runners.name: Vitalline
runners.spotlight: Hold-up performer who scored over 6f at Kempton last month and has been placed in his last two runs, including a close call at Lingfield (7f); needs the cards to fall right but he's a player if he gets a good pace and some luck.

runners.comment: Won over C&D last month but well held in both subsequent runs; first-time cheekpieces
runners.name: Lady Bouquet
runners.spotlight: Turned things around with a win over C&D last month but she's finished a well-held sixth on Tapeta in both subsequent runs; has a bit to prove again and needs first-time cheekpieces to give her a lift.

runners.comment: Ten-time winner but he's been out of sorts this winter and needs to get back on track
runners.name: Red Walls
runners.spotlight: All ten wins have been on AW including five at this track; runner-up off 2lb higher over C&D in September but it has been tough going since and others look safer.

runners.comment: Respectable efforts over C&D of late but losing run is mounting up; others preferred
runners.name: Sisters In The Sky
runners.spotlight: Respectable efforts in classified events over C&D in last two runs but losing run is mounting up and he needs to find more back in a handicap.

17:00.race_name: Read Meg Nicholls' Blog At betmgm.co.uk Handicap (Div I)

runners.comment: Unexposed gelding but he needs improvement back up in trip
runners.name: King Of Chaos
runners.spotlight: Made a promising start when third at Windsor (6f, good) last May but he's not gone from that and was only fourth of six on recent handicap/stable debut at Newcastle (5f, Tapeta); still unexposed after only four runs but he needs improvement back up in trip.

runners.comment: Made all in 7f novice here last month and she's open to more progress on handicap debut
runners.name: Jamie Sommers
runners.spotlight: Made it third-time lucky in novice events when making all for a narrow success here (7f) on her reappearance last month; that was a good opportunity, but she has a progressive profile and is respected back at 6f on handicap debut.

runners.comment: Completed a double over C&D two weeks ago and he's open to more progress; key player
runners.name: Grey Horizon
runners.spotlight: Won at Catterick in October and has found new reserves on Tapeta for this yard since, making virtually all at Southwell before following up with a strong-finishing success over C&D; up another 3lb but he's on a roll and is open to more progress; key player.

runners.comment: Held at 9-2 or shorter in all four runs and needs a transformation with tongue-tie added
runners.name: Berlinetta
runners.spotlight: Cost 260,000gns as a yearling but she's been held at 9-2 or shorter in all four runs including when last of seven on recent handicap debut at Southwell (6f, Tapeta); with top yard and still early days but she needs a transformation with tongue-tie added.

runners.comment: Lightly raced gelding but has plenty to prove on return for new yard
runners.name: Runamara
runners.spotlight: Won a Bath maiden (5.7f, soft) last September but he struggled in nurseries in final three runs for Kevin Philippart De Foy; still lightly raced but he's untried on Tapeta and has plenty to prove on return for new yard.

runners.comment: Seven-race maiden who was disappointing over 1m at Lingfield last time; down the list
runners.name: Credit Forgedd It
runners.spotlight: Made a bold bid when a close second in a nursery here (8.6f) last month but he failed to back that up at Lingfield (1m) four days later; that may have come too soon but he's now 0-7 and has a bit to prove again back at this trip.

runners.comment: Off the mark with an emphatic win at Newcastle; 9lb higher here but he's respected
runners.name: Watchdog
runners.owner: Richard Fahey Ebor Racing Club Ltd
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the sixth attempt with an emphatic win in a Newcastle nursery (6f, Tapeta) last month; 9lb higher here but his form has really taken off recently and he could continue on an upward curve; respected.

runners.comment: Unexposed filly who returns after wind surgery; market informative on handicap debut
runners.name: Alfa Duplicate
runners.spotlight: Unexposed filly who had wind surgery after an encouraging second in a C&D novice last June; this is competitive on handicap debut but she has a good pedigree and needs watching in market on her return.

runners.comment: 0-5 but he ran better than bare facts behind Grey Horizon here latest; not ruled out
runners.name: Faithful Dream
runners.spotlight: Five-race maiden; reappeared after wind surgery with a fifth behind Grey Horizon over C&D two weeks ago but he ran into some trouble and was beaten less than 3l; should benefit from that run and he's not ruled out.

17:30.race_name: Read Meg Nicholls' Blog At betmgm.co.uk Handicap (Div II)

runners.comment: Has solid record and could be a big factor if he can find a bit extra; cheekpieces added
runners.name: Mighty Vega
runners.owner: D Macauliffe A Don & LDS Bloodstock
runners.spotlight: Narrowly made a winning return in Kempton novice (6f) in November and he's run to a similar level in three handicaps since; was only beaten 1l when front-running at Kempton last Monday and he should give it another good shot; cheekpieces added.

runners.comment: Unexposed filly and she needs a close look back up in trip on handicap debut
runners.name: Whizzy Dizzy
runners.spotlight: Mixed form in three qualifying runs since October but she went close at Lingfield (5f, Polytrack) on her second start; should have more to offer now switched to handicapping and she needs a close look back up in trip.

runners.comment: 0-6 but she went close over 5f here in October; interesting back up in trip on return
runners.name: Moretons
runners.spotlight: Six-race maiden but she finished well from off the pace when going close in a 5f nursery here (100-30) in October; on same mark on her return and she's an interesting contender back up in trip; cheekpieces added.

runners.comment: 0-4 for the Gosdens and he needs improvement on return for new yard; hood on
runners.name: Yachtsman
runners.spotlight: 0-4 for the Gosdens and was down the field on handicap debut at Windsor (5f, good to firm) last August; changed hands for 20,000gns since and been gelded; hood is added on this step back up in trip but he needs improvement on return for new yard.

runners.comment: Lightly raced filly but she's been well held in both handicaps and others are preferred
runners.name: Nalas Dream
runners.owner: Richard Fahey Ebor Racing Club Ltd
runners.spotlight: Went close in a C&D novice in the autumn but she's been well held in two handicaps since; still early days but she missed the break at Southwell (25-1) last time and needs a transformation back at this track.

runners.comment: Some promise in novice events but was last of seven on nursery debut at Kempton
runners.name: Hello Its Me
runners.spotlight: Showed promise in some novice events in the autumn but was last of seven on her nursery debut at Kempton (6f, AW) in November; visor is now added after a break and she needs do much better on this return to Tapeta.

runners.comment: Exposed filly who is 1-11 and was down the field at Lingfield last time
runners.name: Corniche Girl
runners.owner: C Munro Mrs M Gander And Partner
runners.spotlight: Won a Kempton nursery (6f, AW) last August but she's not gone on from that and was never involved at Lingfield on her final run last year; record is now 1-11 and others are more convincing.

runners.comment: Runner-up at Lingfield last week but was beaten 5l and he's now 0-7 in handicaps
runners.name: Mister Moet
runners.spotlight: Sole win was in a Carlisle novice (6f, good to soft) last May; runner-up on AW in last two starts but he was beaten 5l at Lingfield last Wednesday and is now 0-7 in handicaps; needs to find more.

18:00.race_name: Bet £10 Get £40 With BetMGM Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Tailed off in two bumpers and same story in two runs at Wolverhampton this winter
runners.name: Miss Helena
runners.spotlight: Failed to beat a rival in pair of bumpers and same story when tailed off in two novice events here (9.4f/7f) this winter.

runners.comment: Made a bright start with a comfortable win over C&D last month; respected under penalty
runners.name: Chantelle
runners.spotlight: Gleneagles filly who made a good start when finishing well for a comfortable success in a 7f novice here (16-1) last month; that form has been boosted by the third since and this scopey filly looks a useful prospect; strongly respected under penalty.

runners.comment: Well held in two 7f runs this winter, with an RPR of 47 on both occasions
runners.name: Ada Rose
runners.spotlight: Well held in two 7f runs this winter, with an RPR of 47 on both occasions; remains best watched at this level.

runners.comment: Useful pedigree but she struggled in two runs at Kempton (6f/1m) in the autumn
runners.name: Cari Bay
runners.spotlight: Useful pedigree but she struggled in two runs at Kempton (6f/1m) in the autumn and needs a transformation on her return.

runners.comment: 150,000gns yearling; interesting newcomer and she needs a close look in market
runners.name: Denver Doll
runners.spotlight: 150,000gns yearling; second foal; half-sister to US turf 7.5f-8.5f winner La Cantera; dam placed 6f/7f (including AW; RPR 78), half-sister to US winners Antoinette (9.5f Grade 3) and Javanica (Graded stakes-placed 1m 2yo/8.5f); interesting newcomer who needs a close look in market.

runners.comment: Promising third on C&D debut last month and she should improve for that experience
runners.name: Faffs Gold
runners.spotlight: First foal of 7f AW winner (RPR 72); ran green after a slow start on C&D debut last month but she made some good late headway and was only beaten 1l in third of six; should know more this time and looks a likely improver.

runners.comment: Runner-up in both starts but she has something to find here and needs improvement
runners.name: Get An Attitude
runners.spotlight: Finished second on Newcastle debut (6f, Tapeta) last month but that was at 4-11 in a six-runner race; runner-up again over C&D last time but she faded in the closing stages and was beaten 4l; needs improvement and could be more of a handicap prospect.

runners.comment: Encouraging fourth at Lingfield but she needs more progress on this drop back in trip
runners.name: Uthooba
runners.spotlight: Unexposed filly with a good pedigree; reappeared with an encouraging fourth at Lingfield (1m, Polytrack) 19 days ago, even though she didn't threaten; needs more progress on this drop back in trip.

18:30.race_name: Always Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Handicap

runners.comment: Ran poorly returned to the AW at Newcastle last time and now 0-8; others preferred
runners.name: Renewable Dream
runners.spotlight: Placed a couple of times over 1m on turf last year, but ran poorly returned to the AW at Newcastle (1m, Tapeta) four weeks ago and now 0-8; others preferred.

runners.comment: Patchy form of late; still to convince over this far as well
runners.name: Ottawa
runners.spotlight: Patchy form of late, last month's Southwell success (6f, Tapeta) surrounded by lesser efforts; still to convince over this far as well.

runners.comment: 1lb higher than when winning over C&D last month; drops into a Class 6 for the first time
runners.name: Lessay
runners.spotlight: Not as his best lately, though a race run at a crawl would have been no good to him at Newcastle (1m, Tapeta) 13 days ago; just 1lb higher than when winning over C&D last month and drops into a Class 6 for the first time; interesting.

runners.comment: Sister to an AW winner; market should be revealing on stable debut after three months off
runners.name: Pickersgill
runners.spotlight: Went the wrong way after making a winning return in a Curragh maiden (6f, soft) for Sheila Lavery last March; sister to an AW winner and the market should be revealing on stable debut after three months off.

runners.comment: First and second in two starts over C&D since returning in November, but drawn widest
runners.name: Landlordtothestars
runners.spotlight: First and second in two starts over C&D since returning from six months off in November; races off the same mark as last time, but will need plenty to go right from the widest stall.

runners.comment: Just 1lb higher than when winning at Newcastle in September; each-way claims
runners.name: Enpassant
runners.spotlight: Not beaten far albeit out of the frame at Southwell (7f, Tapeta) the last twice and just 1lb higher than when winning at Newcastle (7f, Tapeta) in September; each-way claims.

runners.comment: 0-12 but has made the frame in his last four visits here; blinkers on
runners.name: Yehudi
runners.spotlight: 0-12 but has made the frame in his last four visits here (7f/8.6f); shortlisted if the switch to blinkers from cheekpieces has a positive effect.

runners.comment: Course winner who has finished runner-up at Kempton last time; visor on and high on list
runners.name: Maid In Chelsea
runners.spotlight: 5f winner here as a 3yo whose losing run is up to 14, but she has finished runner-up on the Kempton Polytrack (7f/1m) the last twice; up 1lb but still high on the list with a first-time visor replacing cheekpieces.

runners.comment: 0-7 in handicaps, but his fourth over C&D last month offers some hope; visor on
runners.name: Blue Eclipse
runners.spotlight: 0-7 in handicaps since winning a Chelmsford maiden (7f, Polytrack) for Alice Haynes a year ago, but his fourth of ten over C&D on penultimate start offers some hope; visor now given a go.

runners.comment: Veteran who gained his ninth course success last month, but hard to know what to expect
runners.name: Harbour Vision
runners.spotlight: Veteran whose recent form has been inconsistent, but he does pop up from time to time as when gaining his ninth course success last month; hard to know what to expect, though.

runners.comment: C&D winner who is back off his last winning mark, but hasn't shown much for this yard
runners.name: Adelaide Bay
runners.spotlight: Won three times on the AW for Jane Chapple-Hyam last year including over C&D; back off his last winning mark but hasn't done enough in four runs for this yard to suggest his turn is near.

runners.comment: C&D winner; narrow defeats in his last two outings suggest he is capable of playing a part
runners.name: Toussarok
runners.spotlight: Still 8lb higher than when winning over C&D in September, but narrow defeats off similar marks to this in his last two outings suggest he is capable of playing a part.

19:00.race_name: Midnite A Next Generation Betting App Handicap

runners.comment: Course winner who ran well when third at Chelmsford last time; cheekpieces on
runners.name: Monty Beau
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 5yo; narrowly made a successful handicap debut here (8.6f) last month and finished half a length behind Oman when third of nine at Chelmsford (1m2f, Polytrack) 11 days ago; cheekpieces given a go and remains open to further progress.

runners.comment: Won in emphatic style here on Saturday; high on list under a 5lb penalty
runners.name: Eupator
runners.owner: Middleham Park Racing I and Partner
runners.spotlight: Made it 12th-time lucky in emphatic style here (8.6f) on Saturday, winning by 5l; enjoyed an easy lead then and has a 5lb penalty to carry but this step back up in trip is no problem and he has to be high on the list.

runners.comment: 2lb below last winning mark, but efforts since returned to AW leave plenty to be desired
runners.name: Great Blasket
runners.spotlight: Course winner (8.6f) who has dropped 2lb below his last winning mark, but his four efforts since returning to the AW in Sepember leave plenty to be desired.

runners.comment: C&D winner who chased home a progressive rival at Chelmsford last time; a player
runners.name: Oman
runners.spotlight: Returned to winning form in good style over C&D last month and, despite a 7lb rise, ran at least as well when chasing home a progressive rival at Chelmsford (1m2f, Polytrack) 11 days ago; a player.

runners.breeder: Lofts Hall Stud B Sangster New England
runners.comment: Failed in his hat-trick bid off this mark last time; may need a stiffer test than this
runners.name: Tortured Soul
runners.spotlight: Gained recent narrow wins at Lingfield (1m2f, Polytrack) and Southwell (1m3f, Tapeta) and may have paid for racing freely early when failing in his hat-trick bid off this mark back at Lingfield (1m4f) since; may need a stiffer test than this these days.

runners.comment: Dangerously well handicapped, 9lb lower than for the latest of his four course wins
runners.name: Eagle Day
runners.spotlight: Recent efforts need forgiving, but that is possible in some cases as with a slipping saddle here last time; has become dangerously well handicapped, 9lb lower than for the latest of his four course wins, and Billy Loughnane is an interesting booking; stable also runs Moby Quick.

runners.comment: Nearly ended his drought at Kempton last month, but has gone back up 5lb
runners.name: Rhythm N Rock
runners.spotlight: Losing run up to 23 but he came within a neck of ending the drought at Kempton (1m, Polytrack) last month, finishing well clear of the third; has gone back up 5lb for that, though, which is little help.

runners.comment: Held off this mark at Newcastle six days ago and this may be an insufficient test for him
runners.name: Golspie
runners.spotlight: Newcastle regular who scored there (1m2f, Tapeta) last month and went down by just a head to Tortured Soul at Southwell (1m3f, Tapeta) at the start of the month; held off this mark back at Newcastle (1m2f) six days ago, though, and this may be an insufficient test for him.

runners.comment: Around 7l behind Monty Beau on his stable debut here last month; needs to step forward
runners.name: Moby Quick
runners.spotlight: Turf winner (6f, good to firm) for George Scott last summer, but finished around 7l behind Monty Beau when seventh of nine on his stable debut here (8.6f) last month; needs to step forward.

runners.comment: Fair third last time and 5lb lower than when winning at Hamilton last May; each-way claims
runners.name: Starliner
runners.owner: David Orr & Miss L A Perratt
runners.spotlight: Showed a bit more when third of 11 behind a subsequent winner at Newcastle (1m, Tapeta) last time and is now 5lb lower than when winning at Hamilton (1m1f, good to firm) last May; each-way claims.

19:30.race_name: BetMGM Supports Safer Gambling Fillies' Handicap

runners.comment: All seven wins have come over further and will need them to go a good pace over this trip
runners.name: Caramay
runners.spotlight: Running well lately and still feasibly handicapped but all seven wins have come over further, including two over 9.5f here; will need them to go a good pace over this trip.

runners.comment: 0-11 since joining this yard, but usually there or thereabouts on the AW; considered
runners.name: Donna Nook
runners.spotlight: 0-11 since joining this yard, but usually there or thereabouts on the AW as when fourth of 11 in a warm handicap at Newcastle (7f, Tapeta; first-time visor) ten days ago; may prefer a longer trip but  still worth considering down in grade.

runners.comment: Placed in all three starts in the autumn; takes on more exposed rivals on handicap debut
runners.name: Welljudged
runners.spotlight: Placed in all three starts on the AW in the autumn, the latest when second of ten in a novice here (8.6f) in November; the longer trip shouldn't be an issue on handicap debut and she takes on much more exposed rivals.

runners.comment: Consistent on Tapeta but has a bit to find with Donna Nook on latest Newcastle running.
runners.name: Electric Avenue
runners.spotlight: Consistent on Tapeta since September (42311254) and should again do her best, but she has a bit to find with Donna Nook on latest Newcastle running.

runners.comment: Well treated on her best AW efforts, but recent performances leave her with a bit to prove
runners.name: Top Of The Class
runners.spotlight: 1lb higher than when third of five in this race last year and well treated on her best form but recent performances leave her with a bit to prove; best efforts have come at Kempton.

runners.comment: Has never attempted this far before and looks handicapped to the hilt in any case
runners.name: Penelope Valentine
runners.spotlight: All three wins have come over 7f on the AW and has never attempted this far before; looks handicapped to the hilt in any case.

20:00.race_name: Midnite: Built For 2026 Not 2006 Classified Stakes

runners.comment: Well held over hurdles last Saturday and he's 1-24 on the Flat; opposable
runners.name: Bigz Belief
runners.spotlight: Triple hurdle winner but his last success was in 2023 and he was well held at Taunton last Saturday; now returns to the Flat for the first time in 16 months and he's 1-24 in this sphere; opposable.

runners.comment: 22-race maiden and he's been well held in last two starts; look elsewhere
runners.name: Bloodhound
runners.spotlight: Respectable fourth in a Chelmsford handicap (1m5f, Polytrack) in November but he's not hit the same level in two runs since and is now 0-22; look elsewhere.

runners.comment: Hard to predict but runner-up here (9.4f) last time and has claims if he can back that
runners.name: Desiderata
runners.spotlight: Just one win from 15 starts but that was at this track last January; has been up and down since but he returned to form with strong-finishing second here (9.4f) two weeks ago; has claims if he can back that up and he's in the mix back up in trip.

runners.comment: Scored at Bath (1m5f) in September but she's not matched that since; needs to raise game
runners.name: Endofastorm
runners.spotlight: Scored at Bath (1m5f) in September but she's not matched that since and was sixth of nine in a classified event at Lingfield (1m2f) last week; drawn out wide back on Tapeta and needs to raise her game back up in trip; cheekpieces reapplied.

runners.comment: Easy win at Southwell on penultimate run and is a big player if he can recapture that form
runners.name: Knight Of Magic
runners.spotlight: Record of 1-28 but his win was by almost 4l in a classified event at Southwell (1m3f) on penultimate run; held in sixth when odds-on at Chelmsford five days later but he had a wide trip and that may have come too soon; has possibilities if things go more to plan and he has run well over C&D.

runners.comment: Second behind Knight Of Magic at Southwell but he's been back in the doldrums since then
runners.name: Lawmans Blis
runners.spotlight: Turned things around when runner-up behind Knight Of Magic at Southwell (1m3f) 20 days ago; that was his best effort for some time but back back in the doldrums since, including a laboured effort over C&D; others preferred.

runners.comment: Triple course winner who went close in a classified event at Chelmsford latest; respected
runners.name: Prince Hector
runners.spotlight: All three wins have been at Wolverhampton (9.4f/1m4f) and latest was last March; placed five times since that last success including a close call in a classified event at Chelmsford 15 days ago; looks interesting if he can repeat that form and he's respected back at this track.

runners.comment: His last four wins have been over C&D but he struggled here ten days ago; risks attached
runners.name: Starfighter
runners.spotlight: His last four wins have been over C&D but he's not easy to predict and was out the back in a classified event here (1m4f) ten days ago; needs to bounce back after that and he comes with risks attached.

runners.comment: 0-13 but was runner-up over C&D ten days ago and he's still unexposed at this trip
runners.name: Dancing Bay
runners.spotlight: 13-race maiden but he returned from a short break with a second in a C&D classified event (33-1) ten days ago; was no match for the winner but he kept on well in the closing stages and he's still unexposed at this trip; dangerous.

runners.comment: Inconsistent nine-race maiden and others are more convincing
runners.name: Good Shot
runners.spotlight: Went close on handicap debut at Lingfield (1m1f, good) last July but she's been up and down since and was a remote sixth behind Knight Of Magic (1m3f) at Southwell last time; now 0-9 and others are more convincing.

runners.comment: Regressive 13-race maiden and he's finished down the field in four runs for current yard
runners.name: Nakatomi
runners.owner: F Reay S McMillan & S Pedersen
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in a Dundalk maiden (1m, Polytrack) on second 2yo start, but he's regressed since (including in four runs for this yard) and is now 0-13; hard to fancy.

runners.comment: Regressive maiden on the Flat and she's not shown much over hurdles; can only be watched
runners.name: Rosso Levanto
runners.spotlight: Regressive maiden on the Flat and she unseated on her first two hurdle starts before a heavy defeat at Warwick last month; can only be watched back in this sphere.
